chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
forall a b : Z, Zis_gcd a (Z.sub b a) |= Zis_gcd a b

Premises:
Inductive Zis_gcd (a b g : Z) : Prop := Zis_gcd_intro : (g | a) -> (g | b) -> (forall x : Z, (x | a) -> (x | b) -> (x | g)) -> Zis_gcd a b g Arguments Zis_gcd (_ _ _)%Z_scope Arguments Zis_gcd_intro (_ _ _)%Z_scope _ _ _%function_scope
Inductive Z : Set := Z0 : Z | Zpos : positive -> Z | Zneg : positive -> Z Arguments Zpos _%positive_scope Arguments Zneg _%positive_scope
Zis_gcd_sym : forall a b : Z, Zis_gcd a b |= Zis_gcd b a
Zis_gcd_minus : forall a b : Z, Zis_gcd a (- b) |= Zis_gcd b a
Zis_gcd_bezout : forall a b : Z, Zis_gcd a b |= Bezout a b
Zis_gcd_mult : forall a b c d : Z, Zis_gcd a b d -> Zis_gcd (c * a) (c * b) (c * d)
euclid_rec : forall a b v3 : Z, 0 <= v3 -> forall u1 u2 u3 v1 v2 : Z, u1 * a + u2 * b = u3 -> v1 * a + v2 * b = v3 -> Zis_gcd u3 v3 |= Zis_gcd a b -> Euclid a b
Zis_gcd_opp : forall a b d : Z, Zis_gcd a b d -> Zis_gcd b a (- d)
Zgcd_is_gcd : forall a b : Z, Zis_gcd a b (Z.gcd a b)
Zis_gcd_for_euclid : forall a b d q : Z, Zis_gcd b (a - q * b) d -> Zis_gcd a b d
Zis_gcd_unique : forall a b c d : Z, Zis_gcd a b c -> Zis_gcd a b d -> c = d \/ c = - d
Zis_gcd_uniqueness_apart_sign : forall a b d d' : Z, Zis_gcd a b d -> Zis_gcd a b d' -> d = d' \/ d = - d'
Zis_gcd_intro : forall a b g : Z, (g | a) -> (g | b) -> (forall x : Z, (x | a) -> (x | b) -> (x | g)) -> Zis_gcd a b g
Zis_gcd_gcd : forall a b c : Z, 0 <= c -> Zis_gcd a b c -> Z.gcd a b = c
Euclid_intro : forall a b u v d : Z, u * a + v * b = d -> Zis_gcd a b d -> Euclid a b
Z.gcd_divide_l : forall a b : Z, (Z.gcd a b | a)
Zdivide_mod : forall a b : Z, (b | a) -> a mod b = 0
Zis_gcd_0_abs : forall a : Z, Zis_gcd 0 a (Z.abs a)
Zis_gcd_rel_prime : forall a b g : Z, b > 0 -> g >= 0 -> Zis_gcd a b g -> rel_prime (a / g) (b / g)
Zdivide_opp_l : forall a : Z, Z.divide a |= Z.divide (- a)
Zdivide_opp_l_rev : forall a : Z, Z.divide (- a) |= Z.divide a
Zis_gcd_sind : forall (a b g : Z) (P : SProp), ((g | a) -> (g | b) -> (forall x : Z, (x | a) -> (x | b) -> (x | g)) -> P) -> Zis_gcd a b g -> P
Zis_gcd_rect : forall (a b g : Z) (P : Type), ((g | a) -> (g | b) -> (forall x : Z, (x | a) -> (x | b) -> (x | g)) -> P) -> Zis_gcd a b g -> P
Zis_gcd_rec : forall (a b g : Z) (P : Set), ((g | a) -> (g | b) -> (forall x : Z, (x | a) -> (x | b) -> (x | g)) -> P) -> Zis_gcd a b g -> P
Zis_gcd_ind : forall (a b g : Z) (P : Prop), ((g | a) -> (g | b) -> (forall x : Z, (x | a) -> (x | b) -> (x | g)) -> P) -> Zis_gcd a b g -> P
Euclid_ind : forall (a b : Z) (P : Euclid a b -> Prop), (forall (u v d : Z) (e : u * a + v * b = d) (z : Zis_gcd a b d), P (Euclid_intro a b u v d e z)) -> forall e : Euclid a b, P e
Euclid_rect : forall (a b : Z) (P : Euclid a b -> Type), (forall (u v d : Z) (e : u * a + v * b = d) (z : Zis_gcd a b d), P (Euclid_intro a b u v d e z)) -> forall e : Euclid a b, P e
Euclid_rec : forall (a b : Z) (P : Euclid a b -> Set), (forall (u v d : Z) (e : u * a + v * b = d) (z : Zis_gcd a b d), P (Euclid_intro a b u v d e z)) -> forall e : Euclid a b, P e
Euclid_sind : forall (a b : Z) (P : Euclid a b -> SProp), (forall (u v d : Z) (e : u * a + v * b = d) (z : Zis_gcd a b d), P (Euclid_intro a b u v d e z)) -> forall e : Euclid a b, P e
Inductive Euclid (a b : Z) : Set := Euclid_intro : forall u v d : Z, u * a + v * b = d -> Zis_gcd a b d -> Euclid a b Arguments Euclid (_ _)%Z_scope Arguments Euclid_intro (_ _ _ _ _)%Z_scope
Z_div_mult : forall a b : Z, b > 0 -> a * b / b = a
euclid : forall a b : Z, Euclid a b
Z.mod_opp_l_nz : forall a b : Z, b <> 0 -> a mod b <> 0 -> - a mod b = b - a mod b
rel_prime = fun a b : Z => Zis_gcd a b 1 : Z -> Z -> Prop Arguments rel_prime (_ _)%Z_scope
Z_div_mod_eq : forall a b : Z, b > 0 -> a = b * (a / b) + a mod b
Z.div_mod : forall a b : Z, b <> 0 -> a = b * (a / b) + a mod b
Z.mod_pos_bound : forall a b : Z, 0 < b -> 0 <= a mod b < b
Z_mod_lt : forall a b : Z, b > 0 -> 0 <= a mod b < b
Z.mod_neg_bound : forall a b : Z, b < 0 -> b < a mod b <= 0
Z.gcd_divide_r : forall a b : Z, (Z.gcd a b | b)
Z.gcd_nonneg : forall a b : Z, 0 <= Z.gcd a b
Z.gcd_greatest : forall a b c : Z, (c | a) -> (c | b) -> (c | Z.gcd a b)
